duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee registration department and act as liaison with US and foreign government agencies, as well as various industry groups
Manage domestic and international registration process
Participate and present company in external regulatory and industry groups including National Pest Management Association, RTF (US Rodenticide Task Force), CEFIC (European Chemical Industry Council)
Guide company efforts in managing state, federal, and international mitigation proposals

Represent company on new or developing industry task forces to address additional data requirements or regulatory concerns and issues, i.e., EPA’s Data-Call-Ins, EU’s guidance document development, or Australia’s SGAR rule change committees.
Act as liaison with the EPA, PMRA (Canada), EU Biocides and other government regulatory bodies.
Partner with Technical Services, Marketing, and Sales to establish priorities and move the registration process forward
Support registrations of existing products across the world
Supervise team of four registration specialists
Develop and enhance team expertise and department capabilities
Provide department support, direction, and priority guidance
Support and guide department efforts to integrate regulatory documents and communications

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Regulatory Affairs, Environmental Science, Law, or a related field (Master's preferred)
